item.title: Jamaat says nothing about 1971 role
item.description: The leaders of Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami on Monday at a discussion vowed to build a corruption-free democratic country if they were voted to power in the elections slated for February 12 next year....

item.title: CU admin building locked for pro-VC’s resignation
item.description: Several student organisations at Chittagong University on Monday locked the administrative building, demanding the resignation of pro-vice-chancellor (academic) Professor Mohammad Shamim Uddin Khan over his remarks about the 1971 killings of martyred intellectuals....

item.title: Presidency University holds CSE Fest 2025
item.description: Presidency University has recently held a CSE Fest 2025 on the university campus in Dhaka....

item.title: Chevron extends artificial limb support in Sylhet
item.description: The SMILE project of Chevron, in collaboration with the Jalalabad Disabled Rehab Centre and Hospital (JDRCH), celebrated the closing ceremony of the Restoring Mobility: Artificial Limb Support intervention at Grand Sylhet....

item.title: Liberation War ideals yet to materialise
item.description: Political leaders, intellectuals, economists, and rights defenders have said that the core ideals of the Liberation War— equality, human dignity, social justice and a discrimination-free democratic state —have not been established in Bangladesh even after 54 years of the independence....

item.title: Victory Day today
item.description: The nation celebrates the 55th Victory Day, remembering the heroic and supreme sacrifices of freedom fighters to free the country from the marauding Pakistani military in the War of Independence on December 16, 1971....

item.title: Indigenous freedom fighters of the Chittagong Hill Tracts
item.description: THE Memorial Volume Honouring Titled Freedom Fighters (Janata Bank Limited, 2012) documents the lives of the heroes of 1971, including UK Ching, a distinguished freedom fighter from the Chittagong Hill Tracts. Alongside UK Ching, who was awarded the Bir Bikrom gallantry title, many other Indigenous fighters from the hill regions displayed exceptional courage during Bangladesh’s Liberation War......

item.title: The unfinished promise of victory
item.description: BANGLADESH is no longer an object of anyone’s neglect. Half a century ago, the world looked upon this land through a mixture of pity and predicted failure, as if the newly liberated nation were destined to remain buried beneath the rubble left by genocide, famine, poverty and structural destruction. Today, when Bangladesh celebrates Victory Day, it stands among......

item.title: Loving a country that keeps breaking your heart
item.description: BANGLADESH is not for beginners. Even the memes tell you that. Step outside, and chaos meets you immediately — traffic snarls, honking horns, voices screaming, endless crowds colliding in every direction. Every day demands stamina, attention, presence. It is exhausting, infuriating, relentless. People argue endlessly. Intolerance simmers quietly in corners. Ideas that are not immediately practical are dismissed. Questioning......

item.title: Where do we stand at 54?
item.description: THIS soil of ours has witnessed agitation, bloodshed, death and pledges to build the nation anew since 1947. The fairest of the demand was turned down; the most vibrant voices were silenced along with the chanters, drenched in gore, the most celebratory moments blackened by treachery. Thus, this nation, liberated from a discriminatory rule for 23 years in 1971......

item.title: Interim govt falters on reform delivery
item.description: THE observations of the heads and members of the commissions that the interim government set up to effect reforms in state governance, noting that the expected reforms have not come about despite people’s aspirations because of bureaucratic resistance and the unwillingness of certain quarters opposed to reforms, including some political parties, are points to ponder......

item.title: Right-wing war talk resembles that of India, Pakistan
item.description: BANGLADESH celebrates its 54th anniversary of national independence today, the most significant day in the collective history of the Bangladeshis, for it was on this day that Bangladesh was born through a bloodied people’s war against the occupation forces of the erstwhile Pakistan in March 1971. The war began immediately after the Pakistan’s West-based......
